Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a carinated body and a long splayed nozzle with a rounded tip. There is a raised rim around the filling-hole; the plain filling-hole area is defined by a rim. On the left side is a dolphin-lug pierced for suspension; on the right is an unpierced lug in the form of a bivalve sea-shell, bordered by a row of small triangles. The sunken nozzle-top has raised edges extending into volutes on the shoulder, and is decorated with a longitudinal groove and impressed points. Within the base-ring is a central impressed point. Covered with a black slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q556.ter)
